2698a37e-c78b-4f78-be0b-ec536c4cb4b3;SEADATANET;sdn-userdesk@seadatanet.org;http://www.seadatanet.org/;2018-09-27T08:18:09;ISO 19115:2003/19139 - EMODNET - SDN;0.1;WGS 84 (EPSG 4326);EPSG;Mediterranean Sea - Temperature and salinity Historical Data Collection SeaDataCloud V1;SDC_MED_DATA_TS_V1;2018-05-31;1;2018-05-31;2698a37e-c78b-4f78-be0b-ec536c4cb4b3;SDC_MED_DATA_TS_V1 SeaDataCloud Temperature  and Salinity data collection for the Mediterranean Sea contains all open access temperature  and salinity in situ data retrieved from SeaDataNet infrastructure at the end of October 2017. The data span between -9.25 and 37 degrees of longitude, thus including an Atlantic box and the Marmara Sea. It covers the time period 1900-2017. Data have been quality checked using ODV 5.0 software. Quality Flags of anomalous data have been revised using basic QC procedures. The dataset format is ODV binary collections. You can read, analyse and export from the ODV application provided by Alfred Wegener institute at http://odv.awi.de/.

name: e895449e-017f-5b4f-a45d-7e2a57f0e337
notes:
SDC_MED_DATA_TS_V1 SeaDataCloud Temperature  and Salinity data collection for the Mediterranean Sea contains all open access temperature  and salinity in situ data retrieved from SeaDataNet infrastructure at the end of October 2017. The data span between -9.25 and 37 degrees of longitude, thus including an Atlantic box and the Marmara Sea. It covers the time period 1900-2017. Data have been quality checked using ODV 5.0 software. Quality Flags of anomalous data have been revised using basic QC procedures. The dataset format is ODV binary collections. You can read, analyse and export from the ODV application provided by Alfred Wegener institute at http://odv.awi.de/.

For data access please register at http://www.marine-id.org/.
title: Mediterranean Sea - Temperature and salinity Historical Data Collection SeaDataCloud V1
